alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 24 at 2:58AM CDT until May 24 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Childress County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northeastern Motley County in northwestern Texas... Northwestern Cottle County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Hall County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 345 AM CDT. * At 258 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles northeast of Northfield, or 16 miles west of Childress, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Childress, Northfield, Cee Vee, Tell, Kirkland and Estelline. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
